title: Jimmy Bullard claims football club hired private eye to follow him: 'It's a mad story'
text:
The TV presenter and I'm A Celeb star admitted: "Your mind starts playing. I was like it's what a spiteful world it can be. I fell out of love with footie a bit anyway and now this? It's like, why, who?" Jimmy Bullard has revealed he has been told a football club employed a private investigator to follow him in a bid to catch him breaking internal rules.
The former Fulham, Wigan and Hull star, 45, did not say which of his former employers allegedly hired the sleuth. But he told how he has personally spoken to him and has seen photographs of himself apparently taken during surveillance, including one of him playing golf.
Bullard, whose career saw him called up once for England before a knee injury forced him to retire, said he first made contact with the man earlier this year after he sent him a private message on Instagram.
Recalling their first conversation, via phone, the former midfielder said: "He said 'I private investigated you once while you was playing for a football club.
Image: FC Bullard/YouTube) FC Bullard/YouTube)
"I followed you... a club got in touch with me and they wanted me to find any rule that you broke in your contract... I couldn't get nothing on you. They was trying to get you to break your code of conduct with a contract'." Bullard added: "He said to me he was contractually obliged by the football club to follow me. It's proper naughty stuff.
"My next question was 'am I the only football player that's ever been followed?'. I don't think so." Bullard says the man, whoâ€¦
